key.name: path
key.description: Path name to the main storage file. The names for supplemental files, including index and lock files, will be computed from this.

key.name: blob-dir
key.description: If supplied, the file storage will provide blob support and this is the name of a directory to hold blob data. The directory will be created if it doesn't exist. If no value (or an empty value) is provided, then no blob support will be provided. (You can still use a BlobStorage to provide blob support.)

key.name: blob-dir-permissions
key.description: The octal representation of the permissions that should be applied to any sub-directories created in the blob dir, and the blob dir itself on initial creation.

key.name: create
key.description: Flag that indicates whether the storage should be truncated if it already exists.

key.name: read-only
key.description: If true, only reads may be executed against the storage. Note that the "pack" operation is not considered a write operation and is still allowed on a read-only filestorage.

key.name: quota
key.description: Maximum allowed size of the storage file. Operations which would cause the size of the storage to exceed the quota will result in a ZODB.FileStorage.FileStorageQuotaError being raised.

key.name: packer
key.description: The dotted name (dotted module name and object name) of a packer object. This is used to provide an alternative pack implementation.

key.name: pack-gc
key.description: If false, then no garbage collection will be performed when packing. This can make packing go much faster and can avoid problems when objects are referenced only from other databases.

key.name: pack-keep-old
key.description: If true, a copy of the database before packing is kept in a ".old" file.

key.name: name
key.description: The storage name, used by the :meth:`~ZODB.interfaces.IStorage.getName` and :meth:`~ZODB.interfaces.IStorage.sortKey` methods.

key.name: blob-dir
key.description: Path name to the blob cache directory.

key.name: blob-dir-permissions
key.description: The octal representation of the permissions that should be applied to any sub-directories created in the blob dir, and the blob dir itself on initial creation.

key.name: shared-blob-dir
key.description: Tells whether the cache is a shared writable directory and that the ZEO protocol should not transfer the file but only the filename when committing.

key.name: blob-cache-size
key.description:
Maximum size of the ZEO blob cache, in bytes. If not set, then the cache size isn't checked and the blob directory will grow without bound.
This option is ignored if shared_blob_dir is true.

key.name: blob-cache-size-check
key.description: ZEO check size as percent of blob_cache_size. The ZEO cache size will be checked when this many bytes have been loaded into the cache. Defaults to 10% of the blob cache size. This option is ignored if shared_blob_dir is true.

key.name: storage
key.description: The name of the storage that the client wants to use. If the ZEO server serves more than one storage, the client selects the storage it wants to use by name. The default name is '1', which is also the default name for the ZEO server.

key.name: cache-size
key.description: The maximum size of the client cache, in bytes, KB or MB.

key.name: name
key.description: The storage name. If unspecified, the address of the server will be used as the name.

key.name: client
key.description: Enables persistent cache files. The string passed here is used to construct the cache filenames. If it is not specified, the client creates a temporary cache that will only be used by the current object.

key.name: var
key.description: The directory where persistent cache files are stored. By default cache files, if they are persistent, are stored in the current directory.

key.name: min-disconnect-poll
key.description: The minimum delay in seconds between attempts to connect to the server, in seconds. Defaults to 5 seconds.

key.name: max-disconnect-poll
key.description: The maximum delay in seconds between attempts to connect to the server, in seconds. Defaults to 300 seconds.

key.name: wait
key.description: A boolean indicating whether the constructor should wait for the client to connect to the server and verify the cache before returning. The default is true.

key.name: read-only
key.description: A flag indicating whether this should be a read-only storage, defaulting to false (i.e. writing is allowed by default).

key.name: read-only-fallback
key.description: A flag indicating whether a read-only remote storage should be acceptable as a fall-back when no writable storages are available. Defaults to false. At most one of read_only and read_only_fallback should be true.

key.name: username
key.description: The authentication user name of the server.

key.name: password
key.description: The authentication password of the server.

key.name: realm
key.description: The authentication realm of the server. Some authentication schemes use a realm to identify the logic set of user names that are accepted by this server.

key.name: drop-cache-rather-verify
key.description: A flag indicating whether the client cache should be dropped instead of an expensive verification.

key.name: client-label
key.description: A label for the client in server logs

key.name: name
key.description: The storage name, used by the :meth:`~ZODB.interfaces.IStorage.getName` and :meth:`~ZODB.interfaces.IStorage.sortKey` methods.

key.name: cache-size
key.description: Target size, in number of objects, of each connection's object cache.

key.name: cache-size-bytes
key.description: Target size, in total estimated size for objects, of each connection's object cache. "0" means no limit.

key.name: large-record-size
key.description: When object records are saved that are larger than this, a warning is issued, suggesting that blobs should be used instead.

key.name: pool-size
key.description: The expected maximum number of simultaneously open connections. There is no hard limit (as many connections as are requested will be opened, until system resources are exhausted). Exceeding pool-size connections causes a warning message to be logged, and exceeding twice pool-size connections causes a critical message to be logged.

key.name: pool-timeout
key.description: The minimum interval that an unused (non-historical) connection should be kept.

key.name: historical-pool-size
key.description: The expected maximum total number of historical connections simultaneously open.

key.name: historical-cache-size
key.description: Target size, in number of objects, of each historical connection's object cache.

key.name: historical-cache-size-bytes
key.description: Target size, in total estimated size of objects, of each historical connection's object cache.

key.name: historical-timeout
key.description: The minimum interval that an unused historical connection should be kept.

key.name: database-name
key.description: When multi-databases are in use, this is the name given to this database in the collection. The name must be unique across all databases in the collection. The collection must also be given a mapping from its databases' names to their databases, but that cannot be specified in a ZODB config file. Applications using multi-databases typical supply a way to configure the mapping in their own config files, using the "databases" parameter of a DB constructor.

key.name: allow-implicit-cross-references
key.description: If set to false, implicit cross references (the only kind currently possible) are disallowed.

key.name: blob-dir
key.description: Path name to the blob storage directory.

key.name: blob-dir-permissions
key.description: The octal representation of the permissions that should be applied to any sub-directories created in the blob dir, and the blob dir itself on initial creation.
